verses.roman:
śākalyas tat-sutaḥ svāṁ tu
pañcadhā vyasya saṁhitām
vātsya-mudgala-śālīya-
gokhalya-śiśireṣv adhāt

synonyms: śākalyaḥ—Śākalya; tat-sutaḥ—the son of Māṇḍūkeya; svām—his own; tu—and; pañcadhā—in five parts; vyasya—dividing; saṁhitām—the collection; vātsya-mudgala-śālīya—to Vātsya, Mudgala and Śālīya; gokhalya-śiśireṣu—and to Gokhalya and Śiśira; adhāt—gave.
translation: The son of Māṇḍūkeya, named Śākalya, divided his own collection into five, entrusting one subdivision each to Vātsya, Mudgala, Śālīya, Gokhalya and Śiśira.
